text: Joining in here as I came asking this same question. I have a blog template where existing pages are fine to edit, but when I create a new post, the body content area seems to have a width of 0 and I can't type in it. Haven't seen this before, but thought some default content would do the trick. The |default item doesn't affect the editor view, so I need some other solution. Any ideas??

Hey Nathan — if the width is 0 it sounds like the content area doesn’t have `width: 100%`  set on it. Do you have a link you might be able to share? Or are you saying that in the editor you are not seeing a clickable area for the `post_body?`

Hey <@UQWGKUEN7>! Thanks for the quick reply! I actually just got it. I've been trying different things, poking around trying to force some width in there. Just found the right element to add it to and I'm set now! Never had this happen before, but that's how it goes, right?
Anyone know how to add a button in the hub spot Tabbed module that will go to a page or an external link
